data_findings.finding: bbox3 is a compiled C++ binary optimizer that takes -n (iterations) and -r (restarts) parameters. Used by top kernels with settings like -n 1000 -r 96, -n 2000 -r 96, -n 5000 -r 16, -n 10000 -r 256

fix_direction technique: Rotates entire configuration to minimize bounding box using scipy.optimize.minimize_scalar with bounds (0.001, 89.999). Calculates convex hull of all tree polygons and finds optimal rotation angle.
Backward propagation: Start from N=200 and work down to N=2. For each N, try removing boundary-touching trees and check if the resulting (N-1) configuration improves the stored best for that size.
Tree shape: 15-vertex polygon with trunk (0.15 wide, 0.2 tall), base tier (0.7 wide), middle tier (0.4 wide), top tier (0.25 wide), tip at y=0.8. Origin at center of trunk top.

C++ tree_packer_v21 uses: squeeze (scale towards center), compaction (move trees towards center), local search (8-directional moves + rotations), simulated annealing with swap moves, multi-start optimization
